snippet: If state and local governments had not cut back so much, the broader economy would be stronger today. So why did they do what they did?
abstract: Robert J Shiller Economic View column discusses concept of 'framing' as it applies to public finance; notes many citizens are simply not engaged, causing public decisions to become quixotic and arbitrary; offers as example that if state and local governments had not cut back so much on employees, the broader economy would be stronger today; holds that natural framing that occurs in real life prevents active government stimulus and so perpetuates an unfortunate slump.
lead_paragraph: If state and local governments had not cut back so much, the broader economy would be stronger today. So why did they do what they did?
